introduction.value: Test suite for ChibiOS OS Library. The purpose of this suite is to perform unit tests on the library modules and to converge to 100% code coverage through successive improvements.

description.value: This sequence tests the ChibiOS libraryfunctionalities related to mailboxes.
The mailbox normal API is tested without triggering blocking conditions.
Testing the mailbox size.

code.value: test_assert_lock(chMBGetFreeCountI(&mb1) == MB_SIZE, "wrong size");

description.value: Resetting the mailbox, conditions are checked, no errors expected.
Testing the behavior of API when the mailbox is in reset state then return in active state.
Filling the mailbox using chMBPostTimeout() and chMBPostAheadTimeout() once, no errors expected.
Testing intermediate conditions. Data pointers must be aligned, semaphore counters are checked.
Emptying the mailbox using chMBFetchTimeout(), no errors expected.
Posting and then fetching one more message, no errors expected.
Testing final conditions. Data pointers must be aligned to buffer start, semaphore counters are checked.
The mailbox I-Class API is tested without triggering blocking conditions.
Testing the mailbox size.

code.value: test_assert_lock(chMBGetFreeCountI(&mb1) == MB_SIZE, "wrong size");

description.value: Resetting the mailbox, conditions are checked, no errors expected. The mailbox is then returned in active state.
Filling the mailbox using chMBPostI() and chMBPostAheadI() once, no errors expected.
Testing intermediate conditions. Data pointers must be aligned, semaphore counters are checked.
Emptying the mailbox using chMBFetchI(), no errors expected.
Posting and then fetching one more message, no errors expected.
Testing final conditions. Data pointers must be aligned to buffer start, semaphore counters are checked.
The mailbox API is tested for timeouts.
Filling the mailbox.
Testing chMBPostTimeout(), chMBPostI(), chMBPostAheadTimeout() and chMBPostAheadI() timeout.
Resetting the mailbox. The mailbox is then returned in active state.

code.value: chMBReset(&mb1); chMBResumeX(&mb1);

description.value: Testing chMBFetchTimeout() and chMBFetchI() timeout.
This sequence tests the ChibiOS library functionalities related to memory pools.

brief.value: Loading and emptying a memory pool.

description.value: The memory pool functionality is tested by loading and emptying it, all conditions are tested.
Adding the objects to the pool using chPoolLoadArray().

code.value: chPoolLoadArray(&mp1, objects, MEMORY_POOL_SIZE);

description.value: Emptying the pool using chPoolAlloc().

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) test_assert(chPoolAlloc(&mp1) != NULL, "list empty");

description.value: Now must be empty.

code.value: test_assert(chPoolAlloc(&mp1) == NULL, "list not empty");

description.value: Adding the objects to the pool using chPoolFree().

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) chPoolFree(&mp1, &objects[i]);

description.value: Emptying the pool using chPoolAlloc() again.

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) test_assert(chPoolAlloc(&mp1) != NULL, "list empty");

description.value: Now must be empty again.

code.value: test_assert(chPoolAlloc(&mp1) == NULL, "list not empty");

description.value: Covering the case where a provider is unable to return more memory.

code.value: chPoolObjectInit(&mp1, sizeof (uint32_t), null_provider); test_assert(chPoolAlloc(&mp1) == NULL, "provider returned memory");

brief.value: Loading and emptying a guarded memory pool without waiting.

description.value: The memory pool functionality is tested by loading and emptying it, all conditions are tested.
Adding the objects to the pool using chGuardedPoolLoadArray().

code.value: chGuardedPoolLoadArray(&gmp1, objects, MEMORY_POOL_SIZE);

description.value: Emptying the pool using chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout().

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) test_assert(chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout(&gmp1, TIME_IMMEDIATE) != NULL, "list empty");

description.value: Now must be empty.

code.value: test_assert(chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout(&gmp1, TIME_IMMEDIATE) == NULL, "list not empty");

description.value: Adding the objects to the pool using chGuardedPoolFree().

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) chGuardedPoolFree(&gmp1, &objects[i]);

description.value: Emptying the pool using chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout() again.

code.value: for (i = 0; i < MEMORY_POOL_SIZE; i++) test_assert(chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout(&gmp1, TIME_IMMEDIATE) != NULL, "list empty");

description.value: Now must be empty again.

code.value: test_assert(chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout(&gmp1, TIME_IMMEDIATE) == NULL, "list not empty");

description.value: The timeout features for the Guarded Memory Pools is tested.
Trying to allocate with 100mS timeout, must fail because the pool is empty.

code.value: test_assert(chGuardedPoolAllocTimeout(&gmp1, TIME_MS2I(100)) == NULL, "list not empty");

description.value: This sequence tests the ChibiOS library functionalities related to memory heaps.

Series of allocations/deallocations are performed in carefully designed sequences in order to stimulate all the possible code paths inside the allocator. The test expects to find the heap back to the initial status after each sequence.
Testing initial conditions, the heap must not be fragmented and one free block present.

code.value: test_assert(chHeapStatus(&test_heap, &sz, NULL) == 1, "heap fragmented");

description.value: Trying to allocate an block bigger than available space, an error is expected.

code.value: p1 = chHeapAlloc(&test_heap, sizeof test_heap_buffer * 2); test_assert(p1 == NULL, "allocation not failed");

description.value: Single block allocation using chHeapAlloc() then the block is freed using chHeapFree(), must not fail.
Using chHeapStatus() to assess the heap state. There must be at least one free block of sufficient size.
Allocating then freeing in the same order.
Allocating then freeing in reverse order.
Small fragments handling. Checking the behavior when allocating blocks with size not multiple of alignment unit.
Skipping a fragment, the first fragment in the list is too small so the allocator must pick the second one.
Allocating the whole available space.
Testing final conditions. The heap geometry must be the same than the one registered at beginning.

code.value: test_assert(chHeapStatus(&test_heap, &n, NULL) == 1, "heap fragmented"); test_assert(n == sz, "size changed");

description.value: The default heap is pre-allocated in the system. We test base functionality.
Single block allocation using chHeapAlloc() then the block is freed using chHeapFree(), must not fail.
Testing allocation failure.

code.value: p1 = chHeapAlloc(NULL, (size_t)-256); test_assert(p1 == NULL, "allocation not failed");
